job_title: Dining Services Associate in Tempe, AZ
pros: As a relatively new employee with FVT I have been impressed with the common goal of employees, management and residents to create and thrive in a positive, upbeat active environment. I appreciate the effort encouraged by the "Work Tango" app. I enjoy the employee cafeteria offerings daily including the salad bar and soup of the day. Mostly I enjoy my coworkers. I 100% am impressed with the reputation of FVT and the benefits package.
cons: My shifts do not coincide with the shuttle service so my #1 con is parking.

pros: Working amongst the residents and my coworkers
cons: Pay should be a little bit better.

pros: Friendship Village has a work culture like no other. I enjoy coming to work and feel valued. I have never worked for a company that actually cares for their employees. I love my job at Friendship Village.
cons: Some of the positions do consist of working outside.

review_title: Caring and Friendly Good to Employees

job_title: Health and Fitness Specialist in Tempe, AZ
pros: Friendship Village Tempe has a wonderful culture of friendliness amongst staff. Supervisors are knowledgeable and approachable and willing to assist staff in problem solving. There is a sense of camaraderie and helpfulness from the top down. It is, I believe, a great place to work.
cons: Salaries are slightly lower, but there is a good benefits package to make up the difference.

pros: Friendship Village Tempe is clean, professional, organized, and full of happy residents and workers. They feed you for free every shift in the employee buffet. Workday scheduling is posted 4 weeks in advance, and they try to keep it to the same days and hours.
cons: I can't think of any.

pros: Good benefits great staff great residents
cons: No parking for employees in front

review_title: Great place to work, love my job!
job_title: Licensed Nursing Assistant LNA in Tempe, AZ
pros: Working with the Independent Living residents is fun and stimulating. Residents appreciate our help and like to know us as real individuals with lives outside of work. I have a lot of freedom in my job and feel like I am treated as a trusted professional and an adult. Co-workers are kind, cooperative and supportive. Turnover in many departments is very low as the environment is so positive. As a later in life CNA, I was so demoralized by other CNA jobs I was ready to give up but working here has restored my faith in rewarding CNA positions where one can make a difference in seniors' lives without ruining their own health by fulfilling job expectations. Hope the same can be said by those working in the Health Care Center.
cons: While our benefits are really great, the hourly pay and potential for increases could be improved.

pros: The residents at Friendship Village are some of the most appreciative, fascinating and pleasant folks I ever been of service to.
cons: Been running understaffed for many months and now a vaccine mandate has been imposed that all but destroyed the work/life balance culture for those who remain.

review_title: Patient oriented facility that appreciates all staff
pros: Patient centered, generous, caring, quality customer service, professional
cons: No Cons at this time

pros: Great benefits, great residents, and great management team. Everyone is friendly and I look forward to coming to work. It feels like a second family. I love how I can be creative with my job and spend time with my residents and their family.
cons: Always hard to loose a resident. They touch your heart and become family.

pros: Clean, pretty environment and decent staff/patient ratios.
cons: Dated EMR (being replaced with PCC) and employees often talk behind each other's back.

pros: the benefits are cheaper than in other companies. some of the employees really care and are there for the right reasons. others just there for a paycheck.
cons: Gossip. Low pay. Low PTO. under-appreciated. lets middle managers get away with too much and not be held accountable. Favoritism. understaffed. No diversity at the upper management level. Sexual harassment swept under the run.

pros: Friendship village Tempe is by far ,  best of the best facility that I have worked in. I've worked as an LNA for approximately 8 years. My experience is that Friendship Village Tempe provides a safe and clean and fun atmosphere for the residents.There's lots of activities for the residents as well as the employees. Lots of incentives encourages both residents and employees to give their best. Friendship Village is a wonderful place to work.
cons: Being that we live in an imperfect world. I'm sure there's a downside to working at Friendship Village Tempe. The morale of employees as well as the residence make up what can be a successful and fun pace of employment. For the most part the morale here at Friendship Village Tempe is VERY Good.

pros: It has a family atmosphere. They offer really good benefits.  If you are new to the job market, there is room for advancement within the organization.  The residents really care about the employees that care for them.
cons: As a professional, there was no room for growth opportunities. Certain departments and positions are not appreciated by the organization.  They are middle of the road when it comes to pay unless you really know someone of status.  Management are not held accountable for the most part.

review_title: Friendship Village is a great place to work!
pros:
There's no stress or pressure to finish a project.
Our supervisor is excellent and makes the working experience very pleasant.
You just need to stay busy and work toward completing what you're working on until it's time to clean up and go home.
It's a very safe atmosphere, no dangerous high ladder work.
Work with very friendly people and enjoy each day.
The residents are very nice, it's a pleasure to work around them.
There are a lot of really nice benefits, like a wellness program. 
Use the exercise area with treadmill, elliptical, bicycle, and various machines to strengthen your body, for only $5 per month.
cons: mmm...that's a tough one, there isn't anything that I dislike.

pros:
Some of the greatest things about Friendship Village that will always stand out are:
• Superb hospitality - from the Staff to the residents, everyone treats one another with utmost respect, care, and compassion, creating a very secure and warm atmosphere.
• Great focus - most companies say they care and know their employees, but FVT takes that to the next level and spends the time to get to know you as a person and as a employee.
• Focused - while FVT may not pay as well as other jobs, they go above and beyond in achieving their mission and goal to give their staff/residents the best experience every day, every hour. At FVT, money doesn't get in the way of their team from giving everyone exceptional service and fabulous experiences.
cons:
Most of these are due to current events, so they are subject to change:
• Chaotic to start - at the beginning of my employment, I found things to be a bit on the more challenging side due to the amount of improvisation that needed to be done. Because COVID-19 has largely distributed the business world, FVT has had to make new routines/regulations that can at first be a bit tricky to handle at first.
• Lots of responsibility - working at FVT requires high performance, willpower, and dedication. Those who aren't interested in the genuine benefits of others and servitude to the elderly may not find Friendship Village suitable for them. Passion and accountability are two major qualities that are very likely to be required when working with FVT.

While not everyone may find these aspects to be "cons", there are those who will find these qualifications unsuitable for them. That is why I deemed them neccessary to entail. If these aspects are of no bother to you and you want to help people in the world, then working at FVT is the absolute perfect place for you to do just that.

pros:
The residents are wonderful. 
The pay was above minimum wage. 
They trained me well. 
The break room has cheap, yummy food. 
They build an awesome environment for the workers;
Like giving movie tickets and hosting sports leagues.
cons:
There’s two hours between lunch and dinner shift that often felt wasted because I stayed (home was to far) and got nothing done. 
Parking can be tight on some days

pros: I have been working at Friendship Village for about a year now. Every single person including vendors residence employees  are sslway so polite, always greeting you with a smile.. I love working here amazing benefits as well as great hours.
cons: I have yet to come across anything that I dislike here at the moment.

pros:
The staff is friendly.
The residents are just wonderful.
The employee lunch/break room has fresh hot food or a salad bar with a really nice employee discount.
Technology is up to date so the systems are easy to use.
Ongoing training, company meetings and holiday parties make you feel like your important and part of the family.
cons: It can be hard to have residents that you care about pass away.

pros: This is an awesome place to be. I love it here and so do our residents! We make sure they always come first and that our residents are comfortable. I as an employee really enjoy seeing their happy smiling faces and try to do all I can for them. One of the best places to work!!
cons: I haven't found a single bad thing nothing but amazing!!

pros: Very neat, residents/employee oriented. Adequate supply of equipments to work with. Friendly environment
cons: I am there 4 years now because it is good to me otherwise I would have left

pros: Benefits: Vision, Dental, Medical, Life, Disability, HSA, FSA. Paid holidays. Company culture. Friendly co-workers. Great leadership/management. Open-door policy.
cons: Limited Parking but I hear they are working on adding more.

pros: Family & Customer Service Oriented non-profit company who have a passion for helping the elderly and providing excellent Healthcare.  Many employee perks and down to earth management.
cons: None really, non corporate company so no room for advancement outside the medium sized location.

pros: The Village Mission is what drives this company. It is a great atmosphere.
cons: They feed you too well. I have gained weight. ( but they also have a fitness program) so my own fault I guess. Food is too good to turn down though.
